fields.description:
Test cases of TestWriteToReplica failed in windows with errors like:
h4. !https://builds.apache.org/static/fc5100d0/images/16x16/document_delete.png!  Error Details

Could not fully delete F:\short\hadoop-trunk-win\s\hadoop-hdfs-project\hadoop-hdfs\target\test\data\1\dfs\name-0-1
h4. !https://builds.apache.org/static/fc5100d0/images/16x16/document_delete.png!  Stack Trace

fields.summary: Test cases of TestWriteToReplica failed in windows

comments.body:
I just changed the state to trigger Yetus.
[~surmountian] can you describe what the fix is exactly?
It looks like now we will use a different path for each MiniDFSCluster.

Currently on Windows, while running tests of TestWriteToReplica, only 1 of the 6 will pass, the others fail due to accessing the same path to build MiniDFSCluster, however, each test can pass if it runs alone.

The change in the patch generate randomized path for miniDFS base dir, so there won't be conflict between test cases, and with it they can pass while run at the same time.

Should we push this change into the MiniDFSCluster itslef and make the path for it to be randomized always?

[~chris.douglas], this is the root cause for most of the failed unit tests in Windows.
MiniDFSClusters left behind and not properly cleaned; in Windows the file descriptor are also locking so no new tests can run.
We should improve the resilience of the tests to cleanup properly but this could be a fix for now.

[~surmountian], there is an unused import in the patch.
Other than that, this looks good.

TestWebHdfsTimeouts seems to be failing consistently now.
HDFS-11043 tried to fix this but not looking good now.
Thanks [~elgoiri], I updated the patch with the unused import removed.

Lots of failed unit tests for  [^HDFS-13336.002.patch] but none seem related ([^HDFS-13336.001.patch] was pretty much the same and only failed TestWebHdfsTimeouts).
+1
I'll commit tomorrow if there are no comments.

As [~elgoiri] suggested, a generic fix could be made for org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.MiniDFSCluster#determineDfsBaseDir, if by default a randomized temp path is returned(with GenericTestUtils.getRandomizedTempPath()) while HDFS_MINIDFS_BASEDIR is not specified, many similar test failures on Windows could be fixed. [~chris.douglas] how would you think?

bq. a generic fix could be made for org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.MiniDFSCluster#determineDfsBaseDir, if by default a randomized temp path is returned

This sounds more sustainable to me, not just for Windows compatibility, but to avoid tests that assume a fixed, default base dir.
In addition to the Yetus run, [~surmountian] can you post the report for the unit tests passing on Windows?

Thanks [~elgoiri] and [~chris.douglas] for the fix of https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDFS-13408 , I have updated the patch [^HDFS-13336.003.patch] basing on it, which should fix the test failures for windows.

Thanks, [~surmountian].
For the record, the daily Windows build is failing with the same as you can see [here|https://builds.apache.org/job/hadoop-trunk-win/443/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.datanode.fsdataset.impl/TestWriteToReplica/].
